name: mbfmbfm
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0
body: -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(cdm(c1), cmbfm, cfv(csigagen, c2))))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmbfm))))
-| wi(w0, wcel(cdm(c1), cuni(crn(csiga))))
-| wi(w0, wcel(cfv(csigagen, c2), cuni(crn(csiga))))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(cdm(c1), cmbfm, cfv(csigagen, c2))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(MblFnM))
⊣ (w0 → dom(c1)∈ ⋃ ran(sigAlgebra))
⊣ (w0 →(sigaGen ` c2)∈ ⋃ ran(sigAlgebra))
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈(dom(c1)[MblFnM](sigaGen ` c2)))

-| wi(w0, wcel(cdm(c1), cuni(crn(csiga))))

-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(cdm(c1), cmbfm, cfv(csigagen, c2))))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(MblFnM))
⊣ (w0 → dom(c1)∈ ⋃ ran(sigAlgebra))
⊣ (w0 →(sigaGen ` c2)∈ ⋃ ran(sigAlgebra))
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈(dom(c1)[MblFnM](sigaGen ` c2)))

stmt.origin: 3syl(w0, wcel(cdm(c1), cuni(crn(csiga))), wcel(c1, cuni(crn(cmeas))), wcel(c1, cfv(cmeas, cdm(c1))))
stmt.pretty: 3syl(w0, dom(c1)∈ ⋃ ran(sigAlgebra), c1 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures), c1 ∈(measures ` dom(c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cdm(c1), cuni(crn(csiga))))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cuni(crn(cmeas))))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cuni(crn(cmeas))), wcel(c1, cfv(cmeas, cdm(c1))))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cfv(cmeas, cdm(c1))), wcel(cdm(c1), cuni(crn(csiga))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → dom(c1)∈ ⋃ ran(sigAlgebra))
⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures))
⊣ (c1 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures)→ c1 ∈(measures ` dom(c1)))
⊣ (c1 ∈(measures ` dom(c1))→ dom(c1)∈ ⋃ ran(sigAlgebra))

⊣ (c1 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures)→ c1 ∈(measures ` dom(c1)))
⊣ (c1 ∈(measures ` dom(c1))→ dom(c1)∈ ⋃ ran(sigAlgebra))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c1, cuni(crn(cmeas))), wcel(c1, cfv(cmeas, cdm(c1))))
-| wb(wcel(c1, cuni(crn(cmeas))), wcel(c1, cfv(cmeas, cdm(c1))))

⊢ (c1 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures)→ c1 ∈(measures ` dom(c1)))
⊣ (c1 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures)↔ c1 ∈(measures ` dom(c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(csigagen, c2), cuni(crn(csiga))))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c2, ctop))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmbfm))))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(cdm(c1), cmbfm, cfv(csigagen, c2))))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cuni(crn(cmeas))))

cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(MblFnM))
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈(dom(c1)[MblFnM](sigaGen ` c2)))
⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures))
⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ Top)

comment: A measurable function to a Borel Set is measurable. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-Jan-2017.)
